sentences.sContent: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.sCn: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

sentences.sContent: ...but within six months I was facing the prospect of losing it all...
...The worst fear Leah ever had was the prospect of losing her yoga business...

exam.question: The ____ of finding gold in California attracted a lot of people to

answer.explain: 句意：  在加利福尼亚能找到金子的可能性吸引了很多人到那里定居。speculation：  投机； 思索； stake：  赌注； provision：  供应， 预备。

phrases.pCn: 光明的前景，辉煌的前程
展望；在期望中；可以预料到
期待，有希望；可以预料到

remMethod.val: pro(向前) ＋ spect(看) → 向前看 → 前景

trans.tranOther: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it
